intro: Alibertia tutumilla, commonly known as the red-leafed alibertia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil and Peru. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red foliage and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests.
